original_solution_mapping.L1: Johnny spends 6/3=2 hours walking the 6 dogs who have 60-minute walks.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Thus, he has 4-2=2 hours=120 minutes left to walk the other dogs.
original_solution_mapping.L4: He can walk 3*(120/30)=<<3*(120/30)=12>>12 dogs in this time.
original_solution_mapping.L5: Thus, he will make $15*12=$<<12*15=180>>180 on these walks.
original_solution_mapping.L6: In total per day, he makes $120+$180=$<<120+180=300>>300 per day.
original_solution_mapping.L7: Thus, during the week, he makes $300*5=$<<300*5=1500>>1500.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2278.
    Returns: the total money Johnny makes in a week.
    """
    # L1
    num_60min_dogs = 6 # 6 dogs have 60-minute walks
    dogs_per_walk = 3 # He can walk 3 dogs at once
    hours_for_60min_walks = num_60min_dogs / dogs_per_walk

    # L2
    pay_per_60min_walk = 20 # $20 for a 60-minute walk
    earnings_60min_walks = pay_per_60min_walk * num_60min_dogs

    # L3
    total_daily_work_hours = 4 # works for 4 hours per day
    remaining_hours = total_daily_work_hours - hours_for_60min_walks
    minutes_per_hour = 60 # WK
    remaining_minutes = remaining_hours * minutes_per_hour

    # L4
    duration_30min_walk = 30 # 30-minute walk
    num_dogs_30min_walks = dogs_per_walk * (remaining_minutes / duration_30min_walk)

    # L5
    pay_per_30min_walk = 15 # $15 for a 30-minute walk
    earnings_30min_walks = pay_per_30min_walk * num_dogs_30min_walks

    # L6
    total_daily_earnings = earnings_60min_walks + earnings_30min_walks

    # L7
    work_days_per_week = 5 # works 5 days
    total_weekly_earnings = total_daily_earnings * work_days_per_week

    # FA
    answer = total_weekly_earnings
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Johnny spends {num_60min_dogs}/{dogs_per_walk}={hours_for_60min_walks} hours walking the {num_60min_dogs} dogs who have 60-minute walks.
Thus, he has {total_daily_work_hours}-{hours_for_60min_walks}={remaining_hours} hours={remaining_minutes} minutes left to walk the other dogs.
He can walk {dogs_per_walk}*({remaining_minutes}/{duration_30min_walk})=<<{dogs_per_walk}*({remaining_minutes}/{duration_30min_walk})={num_dogs_30min_walks}>>{num_dogs_30min_walks} dogs in this time.
Thus, he will make ${pay_per_30min_walk}*{num_dogs_30min_walks}=$<<{num_dogs_30min_walks}*{pay_per_30min_walk}={earnings_30min_walks}>>{earnings_30min_walks} on these walks.
In total per day, he makes ${earnings_60min_walks}+${earnings_30min_walks}=$<<{earnings_60min_walks}+{earnings_30min_walks}={total_daily_earnings}>>{total_daily_earnings} per day.
Thus, during the week, he makes ${total_daily_earnings}*{work_days_per_week}=$<<{total_daily_earnings}*{work_days_per_week}={total_weekly_earnings}>>{total_weekly_earnings}.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Johnny spends 6/3=2 hours walking the 6 dogs who have 60-minute walks.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Thus, he has 4-2=2 hours=120 minutes left to walk the other dogs.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: He can walk 4*(120/30)=<<4*(120/30)=16>>16 dogs in this time.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: Thus, he will make $15*16=$<<16*15=240>>240 on these walks.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L6: In total per day, he makes $120+$240=$<<120+240=360>>360 per day.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L7: Thus, during the week, he makes $360*5=$<<360*5=1800>>1800.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'total_daily_work_hours' (4) was used instead of 'dogs_per_walk' (3).
